newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela software piracy cost $209 mln in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela software piracy cost $209 mln in 1996.

text.p: Pirated computer software accounted for 70 percent of the total sold in Venezuela last year, signifying a loss to the industry of $209 million, according to a study by accounting firm Price Waterhouse.

"Such losses represent a restriction on growth of the industry, reducing the creation of new jobs and affecting investment," said the report, which was released by Business Software Alliance (BSA) representatives.
BSA de Venezuela Director Manuel Rodriguez said software piracy could only be reduced through improved intellectual property legislation and enforcement of that legislation.
Rodriguez said software sales in Venezuela totaled $120 million last year and should grow 30 percent over the next two years.
